data.title: 65 Famous Physiologists Birthday, Biography & Family
data.meta_description: List of top 65 popular physiologists. Check their biography and facts about their life. Details about birthday, children, spouse, family, awards and life achievements.
data.text:
Walter Rudolf Hess

Walter Rudolf Hess was a Swiss physiologist who was awarded the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine in 1949. Check out this biography to know about his childhood, life, achievements, works & timeline.

Born: 17 March 1881/ Swiss

Ulf Von Euler

Physiologist and Pharmacologist

Ulf von Euler was a noted Swedish physiologist who was one of the joint winners of the 1970 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine. Check out this biography to know about his childhood, life, achievements, works & timeline.

Born: 07 February 1905/ Swedish

Torsten Wiesel

Torsten Wiesel is a Nobel Prize winning Swedish neurophysiologist who was one of the co-recipients of the 1981 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine. Check out this biography to know about his childhood, life, achievements, works & timeline.

Born: 03 June 1924/ Swedish

Theodor Schwann

Theodor Schwann was a German physiologist who discovered the Schwann cells in the peripheral nervous system. This biography of Theodor Schwann provides detailed information about his childhood, life, achievements, works & timeline.

Born: 07 December 1810/ German

Sir John Carew Eccles

Sir John Carew Eccles was a neurophysiologist from Australia who was awarded the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine. This biography profiles his childhood, life, career, research, achievements and timeline.

Born: 27 January 1903/ Australian

Henry Hallett Dale

Physiologist & Pharmacologist

Sir Henry Hallett Dale was a British physiologist who won the Nobel Prize in Medicine in 1936. Check out this biography to know about his childhood, life, achievements, works & timeline.

Born: 09 June 1875/ British

Andrew Fielding Huxley

Physiologist & Biophysicist

Sir Andrew Fielding Huxley was a British physiologist, biophysicist, mathematician and a mechanical wizard. He was awarded the Nobel Prize for Medicine in 1963. This biography profiles his childhood, life, research, achievements and timeline.

Born: 22 November 1917/ British

Alan Lloyd Hodgkin

Biophysicist & Physiologist

Sir Alan Lloyd Hodgkin was an English biophysicist and a physiologist who received the Nobel prize in Physiology or Medicine in 1963. This biography profiles his childhood, life, research, achievements and timeline.

Born: 05 February 1914/ British

Roger Guillemin

Roger Charles Louis Guillemin is a French-born American physiologist, who was awarded the ‘Nobel Prize for Medicine or Physiology’ in 1977. This biography provides detailed information about his childhood, life, career, achievements and timeline.

Born: 11 January 1924/ French

Ragnar Granit

Ragnar Granit was a Finnish-Swedish Nobel Laureate who made scientific discoveries in the physiology of the retina. This biography provides details about his childhood, life, career, research, achievements and timeline.

Born: 30 October 1900/ Finnish

Otto Heinrich Warburg

Physiologist & Physician

Otto Heinrich Warburg was a German physiologist and physician. This biography profiles his childhood, life, career, research work, achievements and timeline.

Born: 08 October 1883/ German

Joseph Erlanger

Joseph Erlanger was a renowned American physiologist who won the Nobel Prize in Medicine in 1994. Check out this biography to know about his childhood, life, achievements, works & timeline.

Born: 05 January 1874/ American

John James Rickard Macleod

Biochemist & Physiologist

John James Rickard Macleod was a Scottish biochemist and physiologist who is credited for the discovery of insulin. With this biography, explore in detail about his life, career, scientific research and timeline.

Born: 06 September 1876/ British

Johannes Peter Müller

Johannes Peter MÃ¼ller was a German physiologist and comparative anatomist. Check out this biography to know about his childhood, life, achievements, works & timeline.

Born: 14 July 1801/ German

Haldan Keffer Hartline

Haldan Keffer Hartline was a Nobel Laureate physiologist who first isolated and recorded the activity of a single optic nerve fibre. This biography provides detailed information about his childhood, life, research, achievements and timeline.

Born: 22 December 1903/ American

George H. Hitchings

George H. Hitchings was an American doctor who won a share of the 1988 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine. This biography of George H. Hitchings provides detailed information about his childhood, life, achievements, works & timeline.

Born: 18 April 1905/ American

Emil Adolf Von Behring

Emil Behring was a famous German physiologist who won the Nobel Prize for discovering an antitoxin for diphtheria. To know more about his childhood, career, profile and timeline read on

Born: 15 March 1854/ German

Edgar Adrian, 1st Baron Adrian

Electrophysiologist

Edgar Adrian was an English electrophysiologist who was one of the winners of the 1932 Nobel Prize for Physiology. Check out this biography to know about his childhood, life, achievements, works & timeline.

Born: 30 November 1889/ British

David H. Hubel

David Hunter Hubel was a Nobel Prize winning Canadian neurophysiologist noted for his work on the structure and function of the visual cortex. Check out this biography to know about his childhood, life, achievements, works & timeline.

Born: 27 February 1926/ American

Claude Bernard

Claude Bernard was a famous French physiologist who defined homeostasis and glycogen. This biography provides a detailed description of his childhood, career, profile and timeline read on.

Born: 12 July 1813/ French

Charles Scott Sherrington

Charles Sherrington was a Nobel Prize winning English scientist who explained the function of neurons in the human body. To know more about his childhood, career, profile and timeline read on

Born: 27 November 1857/ British

Charles Robert Richet

Charles Robert Richet was a French physiologist who was awarded the ‘Nobel Prize for Physiology or Medicine’ in 1913. This biography profiles his childhood, life, career, research, achievements and timeline.

Born: 25 August 1850/ French
